# Leaked email reveals Amazon job cuts

![](https://www.hrmagazine.co.uk/media/buopwprx/adobestock_283687856_editorial_use_only.jpeg?width=1002&height=564&bgcolor=White&v=1dae8a5ccd96ca0)

US technology giant Amazon has confirmed it will cut 16,000 jobs, after an email apparently sent out in error before the official announcement.


The email referred to many [employees being laid off](https://www.hrmagazine.co.uk/content/news/amazon-to-cut-14-000-corporate-jobs-in-ai-push) in the US, Canada and Costa Rica as part of efforts to strengthen the company, _[BBC News](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cx2ywzxlxnlo)_ reported.

It was a draft document written by a senior vice president at Amazon Web Services, added to a calendar invite sent by an executive assistant to Amazon workers.
